attributes.action: Change the legislation regarding Animal Welfare
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have long felt strongly about this subject, but now feel compelled to make a stand, and have alunched this campaign to see an increase in the maximum 52 week prison term / £20,000 fine for the murder or brutalisation of domestic pets. I have launched this petition in the hope that with enough support that animal lovers up and down the country will finally see a sentence befitting of the crime, and implimented Nationally.

The Law was changed in 2007 after 96 years to make people accountable. This law is seldom enoforced, and it is my express intention to raise awareness and see a further increase to legislation because quite simply, it's not enough.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to change the legislation regarding Animal Welfare.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=Pawz-Fur-Thought


Her Majesty's Government
